intro: Helipterum clementii, commonly known as the pink everlasting. It is a flowering plant native to Australia, characterized by its showy, pink to mauve flowers that bloom in summer. The plant produces small, fluffy seed heads that are adapted for wind dispersal. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy habitats. Helipterum clementii is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers.
